creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: heads and shoulders of two women wearing large hats; women have small, pinched faces; grey and black on white
image_copyright: ©Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York %2F VG BILD-KUNST%2C Bonn
medium: Color lithograph with monotype in blue-gray and additions in brush and black ink
provenance:
Victor (1911-1985) and Jeannette Gruder (1912-1997), New York and Silver Spring, Maryland [1]; by descent to their daughter, Monnika Gruder Drake, New York (until 2007; sold to Galerie St. Etienne [2]; (Galerie St. Etienne, New York, 2007-2008; sold, June, 2008, to Maaß [3]; (Kunsthandel Jörg Maaß, Berlin, 2008-2011; sold to MIA)

[1] E-mail from Hildegard Bachert, Galerie St. Etienne, New York, June 2, 2011. The print may have been purchased during their period of residency in West Germany, 1946-1952.
[2] Per Hildegard Bachert, Galerie St. Etienne, New York, June 1 and June 7, 2011.
[3] E-mail from Jörg Maaß, May 31, 2011.
signed: Signed with monogram and dated in the stone, LRC: [HMP / 08]
title: Zwei Dirnen (Two Prostitutes)
